meanings.definition: Obtain by devious or dishonest means.
meanings.sent1: He fenagled his way into getting a higher grade on the test.
meanings.sent2: She fenagled her brother into giving her the last cookie.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox fenagled the juicy grapes from the vine.
meanings.sent4: The con artist fenagled money from unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky raccoon fenagled its way into the picnic basket.

meanings.definition: Achieve something by means of trickery or devious methods.
meanings.sent1: The magician fenagled the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: The kids fenagled their way out of doing chores by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat fenagled its way into the closed room.
meanings.sent4: The cunning spy fenagled the secret information from the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The sly thief fenagled the precious jewel from the museum.
